docs.snippet: The London Bullion Market Association will take on intellectual property rights for gold, platinum and palladium price benchmarks when they are launched by new administrators, the industry body said on Friday....

headline.main: LBMA Takes Stake in Gold, Platinum, Palladium Benchmarks
headline.print_headline: LBMA Takes Stake in Gold, Platinum, Palladium Benchmarks

docs.lead_paragraph: The London Bullion Market Association will take on intellectual property rights for gold, platinum and palladium price benchmarks when they are launched by new administrators, the industry body said on Friday.

docs.snippet: U.S. fund managers cut their recommended global equity allocation in a model portfolio for a sixth consecutive month in November and increased their bond holdings for the fourth month in a row, a Reuters poll showed....

headline.main: U.S. Funds Turn Against Stocks but Favour North American Assets-Reuters Poll
headline.print_headline: U.S. Funds Turn Against Stocks but Favour North American Assets-Reuters Poll

docs.lead_paragraph: U.S. fund managers cut their recommended global equity allocation in a model portfolio for a sixth consecutive month in November and increased their bond holdings for the fourth month in a row, a Reuters poll showed.

docs.snippet: European investors set up their portfolios to withstand a rise in market volatility in November, building up holdings of safe- haven cash while cutting back on riskier shares, a Reuters poll shows....

headline.main: European Investors Brace for Volatility With Bigger Cash Reserves Reuters Poll
headline.print_headline: European Investors Brace for Volatility With Bigger Cash Reserves Reuters Poll

docs.lead_paragraph: European investors set up their portfolios to withstand a rise in market volatility in November, building up holdings of safe- haven cash while cutting back on riskier shares, a Reuters poll shows.

docs.snippet: A would-be kingmaker in elections in Moldova, millionaire dark horse candidate Renato Usatii, said on Friday he had fled to Russia fearing arrest after his party was excluded from the vote in a move likely to embolden pro-European rivals....

headline.main: Would-Be Moldova Election Kingmaker Flees Country Ahead of Sunday Polls
headline.print_headline: Would-Be Moldova Election Kingmaker Flees Country Ahead of Sunday Polls

docs.lead_paragraph: A would-be kingmaker in elections in Moldova, millionaire dark horse candidate Renato Usatii, said on Friday he had fled to Russia fearing arrest after his party was excluded from the vote in a move likely to embolden pro-European rivals.

docs.snippet: Russia's economy will eke out growth this year but shrink in 2015 as a slump in oil prices and Western sanctions imposed over Moscow's role in the Ukraine crisis drag on activity, a Reuters poll showed on Friday....

headline.main: Russian Economy to Contract in 2015 as Woes Mount-Reuters Poll
headline.print_headline: Russian Economy to Contract in 2015 as Woes Mount-Reuters Poll

docs.lead_paragraph: Russia's economy will eke out growth this year but shrink in 2015 as a slump in oil prices and Western sanctions imposed over Moscow's role in the Ukraine crisis drag on activity, a Reuters poll showed on Friday.

headline.print_headline: In Ferguson, Mundane Choices Lead to Tragedy

docs.snippet: The two friends' morning intersected by chance in the parking lot of the Canfield Green apartment complex. Dorian Johnson had been up since 7 a.m. on this overcast August Saturday and after getting dressed, he was ready for a smoke — on any ...

headline.main: In Ferguson, Mundane Choices Lead to Tragedy
headline.print_headline: In Ferguson, Mundane Choices Lead to Tragedy

docs.lead_paragraph: The two friends' morning intersected by chance in the parking lot of the Canfield Green apartment complex. Dorian Johnson had been up since 7 a.m. on this overcast August Saturday and after getting dressed, he was ready for a smoke — on any other morning a carefree ritual for easing into his day's routine in the St. Louis suburb of Ferguson.

docs.snippet: India's Sahara conglomerate said on Friday it aimed to raise $650 million in loans to secure the release of its chief, in jail for nearly nine months over the group's failure to refund billions of dollars to investors in outlawed bonds....

headline.main: Jailed Indian Tycoon Looks to Raise $650 Million Loan to Fund Bail
headline.print_headline: Jailed Indian Tycoon Looks to Raise $650 Million Loan to Fund Bail

docs.lead_paragraph: India's Sahara conglomerate said on Friday it aimed to raise $650 million in loans to secure the release of its chief, in jail for nearly nine months over the group's failure to refund billions of dollars to investors in outlawed bonds.

docs.snippet: More than 1.5 million Nigerians displaced by the militant group Boko Haram are flocking to relief centers across the country's northeast, where they are met with overcrowded facilities and a shortage of supplies....

headline.print_headline: Nigeria Camps Struggle With Aid for the Displaced

docs.lead_paragraph: More than 1.5 million Nigerians displaced by the militant group Boko Haram are flocking to relief centers across the country's northeast, where they are met with overcrowded facilities and a shortage of supplies.

docs.snippet: For some Americans on opposite sides of a national debate, Michael Brown has become a symbol, epitomizing their polarized views on who bears the blame for the toll of young black men killed by police officers. Brown was a gentle giant, in one vers...

headline.main: Michael Brown's Legacy Continues to Evolve
headline.print_headline: Michael Brown's Legacy Continues to Evolve

docs.lead_paragraph: For some Americans on opposite sides of a national debate, Michael Brown has become a symbol, epitomizing their polarized views on who bears the blame for the toll of young black men killed by police officers. Brown was a gentle giant, in one version. A defiant troublemaker, in another.
